abstract: Berkshire Hathaway, the investment firm run by Warren Buffett, bought stakes in Dow Jones and Bank of America and more than quadrupled its holdings of the health insurers UnitedHealth Group and WellPoint.
lead_paragraph: Berkshire Hathaway, the investment firm run by Warren Buffett, bought stakes in Dow Jones and Bank of America and more than quadrupled its holdings of the health insurers UnitedHealth Group and WellPoint.

headline.main: Buffett Takes Stakes in Dow Jones

abstract: The SLM Corporation, commonly known as Sallie Mae, said on Wednesday its shareholders had approved the $25 billion acquisition of the student lender by a group of private equity firms and banks. The company in April accepted the cash leveraged buyout proposal, worth $60 per share, from J.C. Flowers, Friedman Fleischer & Lowe, Bank of America and J.P. Morgan Chase.
lead_paragraph: The SLM Corporation, commonly known as Sallie Mae, said on Wednesday its shareholders had approved the $25 billion acquisition of the student lender by a group of private equity firms and banks. The company in April accepted the cash leveraged buyout proposal, worth $60 per share, from J.C. Flowers, Friedman Fleischer & Lowe, Bank of America and J.P. Morgan Chase.
